Don Andrés ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo a ODEF con el fin de preparar la tierra para cultivar maíz, el préstamo es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar fertilizantes, abonos y pago de máquina para arado de tres manzanas de tierra y cultivar el maíz. El préstamo le ayudara a tener más solvencia para comprar de contado los insumos. Su meta es cultivar mas parcelas cada vez para aumentar las ganancias y tener un mejor nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Andrés, age 50, is married and has eight children.  He lives with his wife and three of their children in a village in the Morazan municipality in Yoro.

His main business activity is growing corn.  He has been growing his own corn crops for 20 years, and he sells his crops at the local market.

Andrés has decided to request a second loan from ODEF so that he can prepare the land to cultivate corn.  The loan is for 15,000 lempiras, which he will use to buy fertilizers, compost, to pay for a machine to plough three ‘manzanas’ [a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters], and to cultivate the corn.

The loan will help him be more solvent in order to buy the supplies for cash.  His goal is to cultivate more plots of land each time in order to increase his income and have a better standard of living with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, to pay for a machine to plough three ‘manzanas’ [a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters], and to cultivate the corn..

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano,  se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres formado gracias a que  la presidenta en ese entonces contacto con la asesora. Actualmente tiene 14  mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el 2° ciclo.
Gisel es parte de este trabajador grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de todo tipo y marca. Cuenta que ella ha ido creciendo de a poco por medio de su sacrificio y que hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela. Pide de este crédito para la compra de cosméticos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientas.
texts.en:
'San Cayetano' is the name of this wonderful group of women which was formed when the group's president contacted a loan officer.  The group currently has 14 members who are working very happily on their second loan cycle.

Gisel is a member of this hard-working group.  Her business is selling all types and brands of cosmetics.  She says that she has gradually grown her business through her own hard work and that she now has a very good customer base.  She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics.  This will enable her to continue working and continue offering a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en: Toufic is a 55-year-old married man and father of three children. He owns a general store where he sells gifts, accessories, perfumes and stationary. Toufic works hard to provide his three little girls the best education and living conditions, and hopes to stay in good health to make sure that they will get everything they need. Toufic is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to prepare himself for the coming Christmas season with special gifts, perfumes and accessories, in addition to the daily stationary requests. This is Toufic's fourth cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower; he has a good repayment history. His previous loans helped a lot in increasing his business income and improving his living conditions. His shop is located in a good region, but he hopes to move to a more commercial area in the future to expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with special gifts, perfumes and accessories for the coming christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, and compost.  He will also pay for a machine to plow the land.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is a 62-year-old married man and has been engaged in a tailoring business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of his income which he uses for the daily needs of the family.

Jacinto wants to access a loan to buy additional materials such as cloth, needles and spare parts for the sewing machine such as nuts and bolts. In this manner, he can sew more thus allowing him to accept and cater for more customers.

In the future, Jacinto has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as cloth, needles and spare parts for his sewing machine

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is 35 years old and married. She has three children, and she lives with them and with her husband in a peripheral neighborhood of Kaloleni, Kenya.

Kabibi has had a business selling food for three years. She sells a variety of foods. She has established her business in her house, where she tends to her customers and sells them the food that she prepares.

Kabibi is very well-known in the neighborhood, and she has her own customers. So far her customers are satisfied with the service she provides. She says that with the income she gets she helps her husband with the household expenses. She will use the loan to stock the supplies she needs to make the food. She will buy things like corn flour, meat, wheat flour, sugar, etc.

Her dream is to continue working in order to have financial solvency and to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to buy things like corn flour, meat, wheat flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and one of her children goes to school. She has one additional family member. She sells green bananas at the market on retail basis.  She has a motorcycle and this helps her raise additional income. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works six days a week.  

Lydia has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to  become a wholesaler and to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo sagrada familia surgió por contacto de una de las miembros con la fundación, ella quiso ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas y así las surge el grupo y todas ellas trabajan arduamente por salir adelante.
La Sra. Gladys, una de las miembros esta casada con el señor Francisco tiene 4 hijos.Ella solicita el 
 para la compra de insumos para hacer comestibles,ya que ese es su trabajo y le esta yendo muy bien. Galdys tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando así un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
Todas las miembros del grupo estan contentas por la oportunidad que estan recibiendo, ya que el grupo les ha ayudado mucho y quieren poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
texts.en:
The 'Sagrada Família' group was created when one of its members contacted Fundación Paraguaya.  She wanted to help her friends and neighbors and so the group was born.  All of the group's members work hard to get ahead.  

Gladys, one of the group's members, is married to Francisco and has four children.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making food as that is her business and it is doing very well.  Gladys' goal is to expand her business and thereby provide her family with a better lifestyle.

All the members of this group are happy for the opportunity that they are receiving.  The group has helped them a lot and they would like to reach the top level of the program.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, seasonings, meat, chicken and other supplies for making food

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Oñondivepa se llama el grupo formado por 16 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque. Ellas estan entusiasmadas por formar parte del grupo y en cada ciclo ponen todo de ellas para seguir y salir adelante.
La sra. Alberta es Empleada Domestica y también se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, ella esta casada con el Sr Damian con quien tiene 4 hijos. Ella y su marido estan trabajando arduamente por sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles así una buena vida y sin privaciones. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, huevo, carne, etc puesto que son los ingredientes que más usa para hacer sus comestibles.
texts.en:
Oñondivepa is the name of this group of 16 women from the city of Luque.  They are very excited to belong to the group and, during every loan cycle, they work as hard as they can to make progress and get ahead.  

Alberta is a domestic employee and she also sells all kinds of food.  She is married to Damian and the couple have four children.  She and her husband are working hard to provide for their children and to offer them a good life without hardships.

Alberta is requesting a loan to buy flour, eggs, meat, etc. as these are the ingredients she uses the most in preparing her food.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, meat, etc.

loans.name: Koe Pyta Group

texts.es:
El comité “Ko´e Pyta” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní.  Son 12 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que realmente quieren salir adelante y trabajar por sus familiares para darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Ceveriana, quien se dedica a las ventas. Cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, con la cual surte a su barrio y les da siempre buena variedad. Ella cuenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio ha ido creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, lácteos, panificados y demás insumos para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The committee “Ko´e Pyta” is made up of various neighbors in the city of Santaní. They are 12 hardworking and enterprising women who truly want to get ahead and work to give their families everything that they could not have growing up. 

One of these women is Señora Ceveriana, who works in retail. She owns a small, well-stocked grocery store that supplies the kitchens in her neighborhood and always offers a good variety of products. Señora Ceveriana recounts that her store grew very slowly but now, thanks to her hard work and sacrifice, it has become the store it is now. She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, fruits, dairy products, baked goods, and other food items to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, dairy products, baked goods, and other foods to sell.

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia is 42 years old and comes from a small village of Kobuleti district. He has a large family: his wife, two children (5 and 6 years old), a sister and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. His wife works as a teacher at the local school and gets a monthly income. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf; the milk is used in dairy products. Besides, Ilia owns a plot of land where he grows nut trees, orange trees and tangerine trees. He sells the harvested products locally at a good price. He is very hard-working and has a rich experience in his business. 

Ilia requested a loan for purchasing a cow. After purchasing an additional cow, he will be able to produce and sell more dairy products. Thus, he wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, he will be able to reinvest in his agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions of the family will be improved

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 22-year-old single man. He describes himself to be a business-oriented man. He operates a motorcycle  providing transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located ain a highly populated area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Peter describes his biggest business challenge to be high competition from the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle with the addition of the savings he accumulated with the focus of purchasing the new motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi to increase the mode of transportation  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standard. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to his personal savings to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 24-year-old lady. She has been selling clothes for the last two years. When Kashf’s loan officer found Maria, she was living in an old, shabby house with limited basic necessities and no source of income. Her husband was jobless and frustrated, her children were not going to school and life seemed almost hopeless. A loan from the foundation helped them renew their clothes business that had almost died.  Every day, she sets out to the marketplace eager to take as many orders as possible. Maria has recently requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase a greater more variety of clothes in various colors and designs. This purchase will help her to earn more money through her large sales. Maria is saving in hopes that she may get her house renovated next year.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of clothes in various colors and designs to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 48-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be focused, social and a God-fearing woman. She operates a tailoring retail shop where she sells dresses. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within an urban area and her primary customers are residents from the environs. Sometimes, Esther sells rice to increase her business income. 

Esther describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fabric to make dresses to sell. Her business goal is to run a fully stocked tailoring retail business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will enlarge her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old married man, father of five children. He has been the owner of a shoe store since 2008. He used to be an employee in the same field, formerly with his brothers. 

Ali requested a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new autumn/winter collection. Ali is a hard worker; he puts so much effort into improving his business and increasing his business capital to stay in the market and face competition. He has a wide variety of women's and children's shoes and bags, attractive enough to his customers, and encouraging new customers to be his loyal customers.

This is Ali’s fifth time to request a loan from Al Majmoua, where every time he uses the requested loans for the same goal, and he gets the expected result. He is very proud of what he achieved since he stopped working with his brothers and hopes to expand his business to  wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new autumn/winter collection

loans.name: Javyaha Group

texts.es:
El comité “Javyaha” tiene 12 miembros, quieres están saliendo adelante y están superando todo por medio de su trabajo en conjunto. Gracias a eso ya están en su sexto ciclo, ayudándose siempre las unas a las otras.
La Sra  Alma quien fue electa por las integrantes del comité, es la presidenta, ella trabaja en confección de ropas, y cuenta que gracias a este trabajo ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Cuenta que siempre tiene mucho trabajo y que eso es muy bueno, ya que le permite crecer e ir mejorando. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir confeccionando las prendas que hace.
texts.en:
The“Javyaha” committee has 12 members who are making progress and improving themselves through their joint work.  As a result, they are in their sixth loan cycle and continue to help each other out.

Alma was chosen to be president of the group by the other members.  She works making clothing and says that, thanks to this work, she has been able to make progress and help her family.  She says that she always has a lot of work and that this is good because it allows her to continue growing and improving.

Alma is requesting this loan to buy fabric, threads, elastic, buttons and other supplies so that she can continue making clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, elastic, buttons and other supplies

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy tiene 48 años, ella es madre soltera con dos hijos en edad escolar. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, calzados, lencerías,  para damas, caballeros y niños. Trabaja en esto desde el año 2006, visitando locales comerciales, oficinas y casas particulares.
Necesita de este crédito para comprar prendas de vestir para la temporada de verano, pues con las buenas ventas fue creciendo su número de clientes y también la cantidad de pedidos que recibe, esto es muy positivo para ella pues aumentarán sus ingresos y por ende podrá brindar siempre a sus niños una vida digna. Ella anhela lograr que sus  hijos terminen sus estudios y poder culminar la construcción de su modesta vivienda .
texts.en:
Nancy is 48 years old.  She is a single mother and has two school-age children.  Her business is selling clothing, footwear and underwear for men, women and children.  She has been in this business since 2006.  She visits shops, offices and private houses.

Nancy needs this loan to buy clothing for the summer season as she has made good sales and, as a result, her number of customers and the number of orders she receives have increased.  This is very positive for her as it means her income will increase and she will be able to provide her children with a decent life.  She would like her children to finish their education and to be able to finish building her modest home.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Cortes, Bohol.  Her husband operates a mechanic shop in their place. Yolanda has been engaged in a basket weaving business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 

 She requested a loan to purchase 'buri' (native palm), straw and other materials for making baskets.

In the future, Yolanda has hopes of expanding her business and making it sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 'buri' (native palm), straw and other materials for making baskets

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 32-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 7 years. He describes himself to be honest and a hardworking man. He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located at a populated rural area and his primary customers are residents from surrounding villages. 

Andrew describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent water rationing on days like Monday, Wednesday and Friday. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy water storage containers. His business goal is to expand his business by buying a water harvesting tank for water storage and be a supplier  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a happy family whose living standard he will have improved with the profits from the business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Previously, he took out a loan of Kes 20,000 which he repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy water storage containers

loans.name: Antoliano

texts.es:
El señor Antoliano tiene 48 años, está casado con  la señora Ana quien tiene 46 años, ambos de la ciudad de Caacupé, la pareja tiene dos hijos, por quienes se esfuerzan y trabajan por salir adelante.
El Sr. tiene una Carnicería con carnes de primera calidad y también tiene un camión trasganado donde realiza fletes de animales. Por medio de todo esto él da a su familia todo lo que puede y que no les falte nada.
 Solicita el crédito para la compra de animales para que abarate mas el precio de la carne, y de esa forma atraer a más clientes e ir creciendo.
texts.en:
Antoliano is 48 years old and married to Ana who is 46.  They couple live in the city of Caacupé.  They have two children and work hard to provide for them.

Antoliano has a butcher's shop where he sells top-quality meat.  He also has a livestock truck in which he transports animals.  Through this work, he provides his family with everything he can so that they don't want for anything.

Antoliano is requesting this loan to buy animals so that he can lower the price of his meat and thereby attract more customers and continue growing his business.

loans.use: to buy animals to slaughter

loans.name: Gazala

texts.en:
Ms. Gazala is a 42-year-old married woman.  She belongs to a poor family as her husband is a rickshaw driver who can barely meet the needs of his wife and four children.

Ghazala stitches clothes for ladies in her community and manages to contribute to her household income. With her earnings she is sending two of her children to school. However, when Kashf’s BDO met her for the first time, Ghazala was in a challenging phase of her life. Her husband was frustrated with the growing household expenses and none of her children were going to school. 

With her loan she bought a new stitching machine and started working as a tailor. She was able to turn around her life with her dedication to work and Kashf’s support for three consecutive years. Currently she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase one more sewing machine with some reels of thread in different colors so her daughter can assist her in completing orders on time. In future she plans to take orders from a local boutique and will try to become a permanent supplier to them.

loans.use: To purchase one more sewing machine with some reels of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has just completed early repayment of his previous loan of 1,000,000 shillings which he used to purchase goats that he raised and later sold at a good price. He started his livestock business in 2002 and has earned a lot from it, thereby enabling him to look after his family with the basic necessities and to pay school fees for their three children in good schools.

With this loan of 1,500,000 shillings, Charles will buy land for his enterprise and construct a shade (kraal) for his goats to protect them against bad weather and infections. His dream is to be the leading producer of quality goats in the region. His challenge is inadequate land for goat-rearing and infections that attack his goats, causing diseases that reduce his productivity. If he buys some land this time, he will slowly overcome the challenge of insufficient acreage.

loans.use: to buy grazing land for his goats.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 39-year-old married man and father of seven children. He has worked as a taxi driver for three years.

Business is going just fine but he has to pay what is left of the price of the car he has purchased. With the help of a loan requested from Kiva partner Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, Mohamad will be capable of doing it.

Mohamad already received an Al Majmoua loan and it helped him a lot in both social and financial situations. This is his third time receiving an Al Majmoua loan.

Mohamad puts so much effort into providing a good and healthy living for his children; he wants them to feel that Lebanon is their homeland, since they are Palestinian Refugees and they don't have many work opportunities. 

He hopes to open a taxi company in the future and to provide his children with a brighter future.

loans.use: To pay what is left of the price of the car he has purchased.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which produces coffee for export. She has four children and has been doing farming business for 10 years. Her primary income sources are eggs, tea and crops.

She will use the loan to buy more poultry birds.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is that she "enjoys growing beans and maize!" Her biggest challenge is "high cost of inputs making work difficult." The goat has been given the name of "Muiru" because the goat is black in colour.

Jane was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, because she wants to improve her farming. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Microfinance helps small scale farmers to grow their businesses."

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Jane replied that she will be able to provide for the family's basic needs as well as paying for their school fees.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jane owns the following: poultry, pump, bicycle, but does not own cow, pig, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net and running water but does not have electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 39-year-old married woman. She helps her husband in running a grocery store located outside their home. The man shown in the photo is Khalida’s husband. They want to increase their inventory, as the population in their neighborhood has increased in the recent years.

When the couple started their relationship with Kashf five years ago, their store was small and had very few items. Over time, they have been introducing new items to the store and it has become popular in the community.

Currently Khalida has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. She wishes to add new racks to the store to increase storage capacity and to purchase a stock of rice and flour.

She has three children who are studying in different classes. The family is living a much better life than before because they are able to meet their expenses easily and maintain a good standard of life.

loans.use: To add new racks to the store to increase storage capacity and to purchase a stock of rice and flour.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children that all go to school. She has one additional family member.

Caroline works seven days a week rearing and selling chickens from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past eight years. 

She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more chicks and bags of chicken feed.

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Caroline's goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level and to build more rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 29-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as hardworking and patient. 

She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, margarine, maize flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a viable business area and her primary customers are residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge as high prices of items. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy home products for sale. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, salt, margarine and maize flour.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old married man, father of one child. 

He has been working in construction business since 2003. Ahmad was 17 years old when he started working to help his parents in making their living. He works in construction, specialized in polishing tiles. He doesn't have a lot of working fields to choose from because he is a Palestinian refugee and doesn't have a lot of chances to acquire.

Ahmad is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a car necessary for facilitating his business needs. The car will help him move his tools from one project to another.

He hopes to expand his business, increase his income, expand his family and provide them with the best education and living.

He also hopes to buy a house of his own outside the camp.

loans.use: To buy a car necessary for his business.

loans.name: Maricheni

texts.en:
Maricheni is a married man who has one child. He describes himself as a business-oriented man. He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 30 years.

His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are the general public. He identifies his biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy clothes to sell.

His business goal is to run a wholesale retail business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will improve his business. This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rashima

texts.en:
Rashima lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, and one of her children goes to school. She has no additional family member. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

She operates a veterinary drug shop on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works six days a week. She also gets additional income from farming.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy vaccines, drinking utensils (drinkers) and animal feeds. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a track to own a fully stocked veterinary drug shop.

loans.use: To buy more vaccines, drinkers and animal feeds.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Amadu is the married father of three children aged seven, six, and three years; two of them attend school. Poverty limited his educational opportunities, so in 1998, Amadu established his Lacoste, trouser and skirt business. He used to assist his uncle in business for commission, managing to accumulate the money he used to buy a bale of used clothing. The business has now grown from one bale to five bales of used clothing. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,000,000 every month.

Amadu is requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy Lacoste - three bales @ Le600,000; jeans - two bales@800,000; and trousers - one bale@600,000. In the future, Amadu plans to build a house, educate his children, and acquire a shop. The loan will help him develop his business by generating more income.

A hardworking businessman, Amadu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts, trousers and skirts for his business.

loans.name: Ermira

texts.en:
Ermira, an Egyptian single mother of two school-aged children, 14 and 6 years old, is 38 years old herself and a very hard-working lady.  

She has been working in blue collar jobs almost 20 years now and has managed to keep the same employer throughout, and she is proud of this.

Ermira and her children live in a very tiny house that it is not considered safe to live in because the ceiling leaks when it rains and there are water marks on walls all the time.

Ermira now wants to do some major repairing of her home before winter and for this she is requesting a loan of 80,000 Albanian Lek. She is almost begging lenders to help her financially and their help will mean a lot to her and her children.

loans.use: To make major repairs to her tiny home before cold weather starts.

loans.name: Mahluqa

texts.en:
Mahluqa is a 41-year-old widow who lives with her two children. Her son works as a retailer at the food market and gets a monthly salary.

The family’s main income comes from agricultural activities: Mahluqa has 3 milk cows and she produces milk products like cheese, butter and yogurt, which are sold locally.

She has requested a loan to purchase cattle. This will enable her to increase production, significantly increasing the income of the family, thus improving their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, all of whom go to school. She has four additional family members who are relatives.

She rears and sells chickens from home on a retail basis and has been in this business for the past seven years. She works seven days a week. She also practices farming at her home.

Joyce has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of chicken feed and vaccines.

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Joyce's goals and aspirations are: to own 2,000 chickens, to educate her children up to the university level, and to build more rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family member. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and food. 

She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from operating a bar and food stall.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal, bunches of green bananas, crates of soda and beer. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and food for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 800 kilograms of aluminum.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food. 

She sells African attire (Bitenge) in a shop that she rents. She sells her products on retail and wholesale bases. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works six days a week. Betty generates additional income selling used shoes and a motorcycle for hire. 

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 2,500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy rolls of African attire. Her major business challenges are transportation, defaulters and seasonality. Her goals are to start importing African attire from Democratic Republic of Congo and to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of African attire.

loans.name: Kozeta

texts.en:
Kozeta is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, 14 and 12, and they both attend school even though majority of children in their Roma community don’t. She has been selling used clothes in their community’s market for the past ten years and the profit has been good, she claims.  

She buys the clothes in the neighboring countries with help from her husband others in her community and resells them at the market in a major city in central Albania where they reside.

The loan of 120,000 Albanian Lek that she is applying for is to buy seasonal used clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to resell in her Roma market.

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Edicto owns a clothing sales business. He is a member of the El gran esfuerzo ("the great effort") 1, 2 & 3 Group located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic. This group is dedicated mostly to people in the door-to-door business, vending their products on foot in different communities.

Edicto is the hard-working father of six children. He lives with his wife and two of their children; the others are living in their own homes, and some reside in Haiti. He tells us that his biggest challenge is to finish building the family house, and he is still saving his business profits toward this goal. With this loan, he will invest in his business by purchasing products like pants, blouses, shirts, and underwear to offer for sale.

Edicto is very excited to receive his twelfth loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid his previous loan. He has had this business for about seven years. He started the business using the first loan he received from us. His dream is to finish construction on his house and to live quietly in it with his family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 45-year-old married woman, mother of two children. She has been working at making handmade souvenirs and accessories as her own business since 1996, with 17 years of experience in this field.

Iman is a hard worker; she replies quickly to her customers' needs, with a remarkable quality of products produced. Iman has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles, with a good standing and paying-back history.

Her previous loans were invested in improving her business capital through increasing her handmade product needs. Today she is using the requested loan for the same purpose, but she will also invest it in buying special accessories and a 'foulard' collection. She hopes to move her business out of her house and open a special souvenir shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy special accessories and a 'foulard' (scarf) collection

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 35, is a mother of three children. She is married and lives in Sinkor. Her children are between the ages of 9 and 17, and are attending school. Her husband works for a government entity. She has been involved in her business for the past nine years; she sells raw fish at the community market. She makes profit when she sells.

Because she always has to have snapper and bonnie fish to meet the demand of her customers, she has requested this loan to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business.

loans.name: Groupe Nsah.

texts.fr: Josephine est une femme agée de 41 ans, mére celibataire  de 05 enfants agés de 06 à 22 ans tous scolarisés,commercante depuis 10 ans,elle vend les vivres frais (plantain)  dans un marché de la capitale . son activité existe réelement. Elle est une femme batante et courageuse qui sponsorise ses enfants toute seule et elle sollicite le crédit pour acheter un pick-up de plantain et des sacs de tubercules en gros pour augmenter  son niveau de stock qui est bas est afin d'acroitre son chiffre d'affaires ainsi que  son profit. le profit dégargé sera utilisé pour re-investir dans son activité et le reste pour satisfaire ses besoins de necessité et ceux de ses enfants
texts.en:
Josephine is 41 years old, single, and mother of five children, all of whom have received schooling. Her eldest child is 22 years old, and her youngest child is 6 years old.

She has been selling fresh food (plantains) at a market in the capital city for the past ten years. Her business truly exists. She is a strong and courageous woman who supports her children all on her own, and she is seeking a loan to buy a truckload of plantains and bags of tubers wholesale in order to increase her stock so that she can increase her sales revenue and her profit.

She will reinvest some of her profit in her business, and she will use the rest to provide for her children's essential needs.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of plantains

loans.name: Yajaira Vanessa

texts.es:
Yajaira, vive acompañada de su esposo y dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 12 años, ella esta dedicada a las labores del hogar y con su esposo trabajan la agricultura y la ganadería, con estas actividades logra tener una fuente de ingresos.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para los cultivos como abono y herbicidas, tambien comprara alimento para el ganado, con este crédito podrá aumentar la producción en sus cosechas para poder generar ventas a los clientes.
Yajaira, tiene como objetivo permanecer en una ocupación que le permita ayudar a su familia y mejorara su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Yajaira lives with her husband and two children, ages 8 and 12. She is a homemaker and works with her husband in agriculture and livestock. With these activities they achieve a source of income. 

They are requesting a loan to purchase supplies for crops such as fertilizer and herbicides as well as purchase livestock feed. With this loan she can increase the crop production in order to generate client sales. Yajaira’s objective is to stay in a job that allows her to help her family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old married man, living in Beirut with his wife and four children. Mohamad has owned an electronics sales shop since 2005, with 26 years of experience in this domain. He sells electronic games, DVDs and records special song CDs requested by his clients.
 
He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the third time, in order to buy portable DVD players and iPods to increase his electronics variety. Mohamad is always up-to-date with every new released product, because electronics forces you to stay up-to-date with  customers' daily changing needs and requests.

Mohamad's previous loans were very impressive; he stated that they increased his income and developed his business, in addition to replying easily to his family's needs. He assures that Al Majmoua loans help him a lot in educating his children.  His prices are affordable for almost all customers.

His clients can be anyone in the region, including tourists, since he is in a tourist area in Beirut, visited by almost all tourists visiting Lebanon. Mohamad is still hoping to expand his business through selling computer accessories and hardware in the future.

loans.use: to buy portable DVD players and iPods to increase his electronics variety

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothes and Christmas trees.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is a married. John is a transporter, owning a motorcycle; a trade he has run for two years. He learned of Milango from a friend and joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional spare parts for the motorcycle. 

The only challenge in the business is the high cost of spare parts, but John is determined to carry out his operations well because he believes that it is from such a venture that he can establish his family. His future ambition is to be able to purchase a public service vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts for the motorcycle.

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is one of the members of 'El Gran Esfuerzo' (The Big Effort) 4 & 5 group which is located in the town of Hato Mayor. The town's economy depends on farming and it is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. The group's main business activity is selling clothes, and most of the members which make up this group are Haitian immigrants. 

Rosa has two children and they live together with her father. She tells us that her greatest challenge now is to have her own house. She loves going to church and to work. Rosa is very excited to be receiving her 12th loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her previous loans and thereby given a step forward in the growth of her business. She has had her business for almost 11 years. She set up her business with a small amount of savings which she was keeping for business purposes and she started growing it with her first loan from Esperanza.

Rosa is planning to invest her new loan in buying clothes, especially for the coming Christmas season. She plans to use her profits to buy things she needs and start building her house.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and none of them goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (her grand-children). She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 2 years. She works seven days a week.  

Resty has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 900,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a truck to transport bags of charcoal from villages to the market. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medical bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi, who appears in the picture, is a 24-year-old young man. He is married and has no children yet. Shadi is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the costs.

Shadi has been building a house, but due to a money shortage, the building process has been stopped for awhile. So Shadi is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to continue his home's building by purchasing necessary construction supplies such as cement and bricks. Taking this loan will enable Shadi to continue building his house, so he and his wife can enjoy living in their new house soon.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, 24 years old, is a single young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself to be honest and a hard-working man. He operates a poultry business where he sells chickens and eggs. His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Edward describes his biggest business challenge to be when sometimes there is an outbreak of disease which attacks the chickens leading to their death. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy chickens to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved the business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Divinah

texts.en:
Divinah is a resident of Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children.  Divinah owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for 8 years. Divinah began the business from a loan she obtained from a friend. She sells cosmetics, mobile phone accessories, etc.. She plans to diversify into mobile money transfer mechanisms.

She learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is high cost of products. Divinah is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to open a mobile money transfer shop. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the sources of income, targeting a bank agency business. She aspires to own other centers and pay for her children’s education with much security.

loans.use: To open a mobile money transfer shop.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Abdullah, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Hiba is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married with no children yet. Her husband, Abdullah, works in agriculture, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family.

Hiba wants to improve her home's living conditions by changing its old doors and windows, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing and installing new windows and doors to her house. This will offer to Hiba and her husband suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To install new windows and doors

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: When Leticia, her five children, and her husband moved from their home country of Mexico to Garciasville, Texas, she brought along her talent for cooking traditional and healthy Mexican meals. Her business, Letty’s Comida Casera, makes food for seven schools. For the last four years, Leticia routinely begins her work daily at 7 a.m. with her employees: her husband and two assistants. She plans to hire more employees when her business allows. To keep up with demand, Leticia needed working capital, cooking tools, extra tables for her kitchen and additional money to become a licensed business and, therefore, ventured out for a loan. After one of her son’s friends told her of ACCION Texas Inc., she decided to apply and was approved. She said, “I don’t have any money but, with this loan, I can gain money and expand my business. Because of ACCION, I was able to help people. I couldn’t have done it without ACCION.” To find out more about Leticia’s business, visit her Facebook page at: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Lettys-Comida-Casera/512369105445991.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen tools and equipment.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 35-year-old man. He is married and the father of two sons and three daughters. He is a worker across the border, but the salary he earns is low and not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past four years, Rami has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project, but also it needs more support to cover the costs.

Rami is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, flour, canned food and dairy products. This will increase sales and increase Rami's income, so he will offer to his family better living conditions.

Rami is photographed inside his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock of basic groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timber and machines.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio de 49 años vive en el municipio de Malambo,area metropolitana de Barranquilla;  músico de nacimiento, es parte del famoso grupo "Tambó" del Municipio del departamento de Atlántico, donde toca la flauta y el clarinete; él ha participado con muchos reconocidos artistas vallenatos y es uno de los que mas siente el coro que grabó con un grupo musical al equipo de futbol de Barranquilla : “Junior tu papá”. Sergio Halagado de su esencia,  recuerda los momentos en que  acompañaba a  su padre, de origen de origen campesino, a vender   directamente en el mercado sus cosechas de gandules;  de allí nació su experiencia de negociante, la cual la acompañado con su máxima pasión que es la música y que también  la enseña en la universidad de las Artes, sintiéndose satisfecho por trasladar de generación en generación, el folclor del Caribe Colombiano. Sergio conforma su hogar con su cónyuge, una mujer trabajadora, que también sabe de negocio y vende en un colegio ubicado  en un corregimiento cercano, un producto muy conocido llamado "Raspao" o frapee de Hielo saborizado  y tienen  dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 18 años; el adolescente ya está conectado con el arte musical y lo practica y su hermosa hija de 18 es reina corregimiental y de ellos vive muy orgulloso. Sergio además tiene un negocio donde ofrece servicios de internet, y vende artículos afines como papelería y recargas a celulares, el cual inició hace 1 año, para aumentar el bienestar de su familia. Su negocio abre sus puertas desde la 8 de la mañana, hasta las 9 de la noche y su principal clientela está ubicada en la comunidad donde habita y en los alrededores de ella, donde él y su familia(que en todo lo apoya), son muy reconocidos. Sergio está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace, para invertir en dulcería, e iniciar la construcción de su historial crediticio que finalmente es su propósito, pues antes no había tenido crédito y reconoce que este es necesario para hacer crecer su negocio y generar una mayor infraestructura de emprendimiento familiar, que en el futuro le permita aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio, who is 49 years old, lives in the community of Malambo, in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla. A musician by birth, he is part of the famous group "Tambó" from the community in the Atlantico department, where he plays the flute and the clarinet. He has performed with many renowned vallenato [folk music from the Colombian Caribbean region] artists, and one of his most strongly remembered collaborations is the chorus he recorded with a musical group for the soccer team of Barranquilla, "Junior tu Papá." Sergio, proud of his humble origins, remembers the times when he accompanied his father, who was from the countryside, to sell his harvest of pigeon peas directly in the market. This is where his experience as a businessman began. It was accompanied by his highest passion, which is music, which he also taught in the university of the arts. He feels satisfied for transporting the folklore of the Colombian Caribbean from one generation to the next. 

Sergio makes his home with his wife, a hard-working woman who also knows about business. She sells a well-known product called "raspao" or flavored crushed ice at a school located in a nearby village. They have two children, ages 13 and 18. The adolescent is already connected to the musical arts, which he practices, and his beautiful daughter of 18 is the town queen, and he is very proud of them. Sergio also has a business where he offers internet services and sells related items such as stationery and cell phone recharges. He began it a year ago to increase the well-being of his family. His business opens its doors from 8 in the morning until 9 at night, and his principal customers are located in the community where he lives and the surrounding areas, where he and his family (who support him in everything) are very well known. Sergio is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing, to invest in a candy shop and to begin building his credit history, which is his final goal, since in the past he had not had any loans, and he recognizes that this is necessary to make his business grow and generate a greater infrastructure of family entrepreneurship, which in the future will allow him to increase the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to invest in a candy shop

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is the mother of five children and runs a clothes business which she has been operating for two years. In this business, she sells shawls, brassieres, pants, etc. She learnt about Milango from friends, who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are competition and occasional low business seasons.

Patricia is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her meet the family's needs. Her dream is to open a larger boutique and build a rental house.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, a resident of Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya, is a married businesswoman who has been operating a clothing business for six months. This mother of one child also runs a mobile money transfer shop. Her main challenges are competition and occasionally low business seasons.

Having learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, Lydia joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. She is now requesting a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase an additional stock of second-hand clothes and to add till money to her money transfer shop. The extra income arising from the loan will be added to her savings to help meet the family's needs. Her dream is to open a larger boutique.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of second-hand clothes and add till money to her mobile money transfer shop.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in Mariakani, Mombasa. She is married and has four children. Eunice sells dried fish at her local market, a business venture she has run for fifteen years. She started the business from a capital of about 2,000 Kenya shillings.

Eunice learnt of Milango from a friend and decided to join. She looks forward to being a renowned fresh fish dealer. Her main challenge currently is high cost of transportation; she buys fish from Kisumu, Kenya, about 1000 kms away from her business. This has forced her to deal majorly in dried fish. But she is now applying for a loan of 107,250 Kenya shillings to purchase stock of dried fish.

The income from the business will enable her to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock of dried fish.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.es:
Este lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa II, tiene 13 integrantes en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por más pequeña que sea, pues es la forma que tienen de ayudar a sus familias. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias.
Una mujer muy trabajadora es la Sra. Sonia, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Sus productos tienen muy buena aceptación y gracias a eso ya tiene muy buena clientela. Es una persona con muchas metas y sueños, por los cuales lucha para poder seguir cumpliéndolos y ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de polvos, delineador, rubor y demás cosméticos, que son los que más demanda tienen.
texts.en:
This group's name is Kuña Guapa II. It has 13 members and all of them have a small activity they perform, no matter how small it actually is. This is the way that they help their families. These women are very excited and the mutual help between them is constant and above all inspires them to keep fighting fot their families. 

One very hardworking woman is Sonia. She tells us that she sells cosmetics. Her products are well received and thanks to that she has a good clientele. She is a person with many goals and dreams that she fights for to keep them going and to help her family. 

She is asking for this loan to buy powders, eyeliner, blish and other cosmetics, which she has the most demand for.

loans.use: to buy powders, eyeliner, blush and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.es:
La señora Lidia tiene 60 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene un hijo, reside en una comunidad del municipio de Las Vegas, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Lidia hace 9 años que se dedica a la producción y venta de tajadas de plátano verde  y como actividades adicionales vende  chicharrones, ropa y productos plásticos.
 Ella se vio motivada a  establecer su negocio con el fin de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 7,500 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de plátanos verdes, aceite y condimentos para producir las tajadas. 
Considera que el préstamo le ayuda a aumentar su producción y realizar comercialización en otras zonas donde su producto (tajadas) está teniendo mayor demanda.
Su meta es poder comprar un vehículo para poder transportar de forma más rápida su producción.
texts.en:
Lidia, age 60, lives with her common-law husband.  She has a son, and she lives in a community in the Las Vegas municipality in the Santa Barbará department.

Lidia has been making and selling ‘tajadas de plátano verde’ [sliced and fried green plantains] for nine years.  As an additional business activity she sells ‘chicharrones’ [fried pork rinds], clothes, and plastic products.  She was motivated to establish her business in order to help her husband with the family expenses.

She has currently requested a loan for 7,500 lempiras.  She plans to use the loan to buy green plantains, cooking oil, and condiments in order to make the tajadas.  She believes that the loan helps increase her production and her sales in other areas where her product (tajadas) is in greater demand.

Her goal is to be able to buy a vehicle in order to be able to transport her production more rapidly.

loans.use: to buy green plantains, cooking oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa, 42, resides with her husband and four children in Sinkor. Her children are between the ages of 3 and 17; three of her children are not in school. She would like to give the best education to her children, but due to a lack of financial support, only one of the children is attending school. 

For the past ten years, she has been selling soft drinks and mineral water in the community. Because her soft drinks and mineral water are always cool, she makes profit when she sells. With the profit, she buys more goods and repays her loan. She is requesting this loan to purchase more mineral water and soft drinks to improve her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more mineral water and soft drinks to improve her business.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna, 45, is a hardworking mother who has been selling donuts at the nearby community school for the past  seven years to assist her husband with  the expenses of the home. She has two children who are 20 and 23 and have completed their high school education. 

She makes profit when she sells; with the profit, she buys more flour and cooking oil to increase her sales. A difficulty she faces is low sales during the raining season. She is requesting a loan to purchase  more flour, sugar and cooking oil for the  business. Her plan for the future is to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres de nombre Virgen de Fátima se conformo en el año  2.007  y actualmente está conformado por 23 señoras  que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto  en el 12º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
 Catalina es parte de este grupo, y ella vende leche en su barrio y zonas aledañas, comenta que por medio de su trabajo da lo mejor a su familia y está creciendo. Ella tiene muy buena clientela y es gracias a ello que está mejorando, su sueño es poder tener una gran tienda de leche y de esa forma ir creciendo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women's committee named Virgen de Fátima was formed in 2007. Right now it is made up of 23 women who are working very happily in their 12th cycle in a supportive manner together in the program. 

Catalina is a part of this group. She sells milk in her neighborhood and in nearby areas. She says that with this work she gives her family the best and is growing. She has very good clientele and thanks to that she is getting better. Her dream is to have a great dairy store and grow.

She is asking for this loan to buy milk to add to her stock and be able to keep working and serving her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old single young man. For the past year and a half, Mohammad has had a small lab to manufacture hair products to sell to cosmetics stores in the area where he lives. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but it also needs more support to cover the costs.

Mohammad is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing necessary raw materials to manufacture hair products such as hair creams. Taking this loan will enable Mohammad to continue his work and manufacture more quantities of hair products, which will increase sales and increase Mohammad's income.

Mohammad is photographed inside his lab.

loans.use: To purchase necessary raw materials to manufacture hair products.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married business lady who lives in Kongowea and sells sisal fibres. She has been running the business for two years. She also owns rental houses. She is the mother of three children; all of whom are in school.

Kadzo was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenyan shillings to purchase more sisal leaves. Her main challenges are high inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers, and lack of reliable customers. Kadzo will save the additional income from this loan and use it for her children’s future education.

loans.use: to purchase more sisal leaves.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi, who appears in the photo, is a 40-year-old man. He is married and a father to three sons and two daughters; all of them are school students. 

Ramzi is a farmer who works at planting and selling crops, vegetables and fruits, which has been a profitable project. He has a good reputation among customers.

Ramzi is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting his house and installing new electric extensions. This will improve the house's condition and create   better living conditions for Ramzi and his family.

loans.use: To paint the house and install electric extensions

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a resident of Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and owns a charcoal business which has been in operation for the last two years. He began the business with the capital he obtained from the sale of paraffin. 

Said learnt about Milango through a friend and joined the organization with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. His main challenge is the punitive measures at times enforced by the local administration on charcoal sellers.

Said is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family and pay for his child’s future school fee requirements. He aspires to be a wholesaler of charcoal.

loans.use: To  purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Ehab

texts.en:
Ehab, who appears in the photo, is a young Palestinian man; he is a university student. Ehab's father and mother are school teachers; both are getting low salaries that are not enough to cover all the family's needs and pay the education costs.

Ehab is studying at the university, specializing in Business Administration. Ehab wants to complete his studies and pay the university fees, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Ehab and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay university fees

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla es de Ciudad del Este, está casada, tiene 2 hijos menores una niña de 15 años y  1 niño de  7 años. Ella tiene un pequeño local de costura donde confecciona uniformes para empresas, donde trabaja conjuntamente con su marido.
Perla se inicio en la actividad con un dinero  que junto de  otros trabajos anteriores y un poco que del dinero de su marido. Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, gomas, hilos y demás para poder seguir haciendo los trabajos que le traen sus clientes.
texts.en: Perla is from Ciudad del Este and is married with 2 children, a girl of 15 and a boy of 7.  She has a small sewing workshop where she works along with her husband, making uniforms for businesses.  Perla set herself up in the business using money she had saved up from other previous jobs and some of her husband's money.  She is a highly responsible person with a strong will to improve herself.  Such is her cheerful and enterprising spirit that she will undoubtedly achieve all the goals she has set for herself.  The loan which she is applying for will be used to buy fabric, elastic and thread, amongst other things, which will allow her to continue doing the jobs that her clients bring to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, elastic and thread

loans.name: Hedaya

texts.en:
Hedaya is a 36-year-old woman. She is a mother with three sons and one daughter, and she is a housewife. 

For the past one year, Hedaya's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family.

Hedaya is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Hedaya's husband to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

Hedaya and her husband are photographed next to the taxi her husband has.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for the taxi.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María de 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo quien trabaja. María se dedica a la venta de minutas las cuales son un postre refrescante hecho de hielo granizado bañado en jarabes de sabores y con un toque de miel. Así mismo elabora y comercializa tamales de elote. Su venta esta afuera de una escuela publica, lo que es de mucho beneficio para María ya que vende las minutas con los alumnos del lugar al igual que los tamales con alumnos, maestros y padres de familia. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder mejorar su negocio contando con mayor cantidad de materia prima y así elaborar más tamales, también para invertir en la compra de hielo y jarabes saborizantes, y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 59-years-old and lives with her husband and her son who works. Maria works in the sale of “minutas” which is a refreshing desert of crushed ice bathed in flavorful syrups with a touch of honey. Likewise, she creates and sells corn tamales.  Her sales are in from of a public school, which is very beneficial to Maria since she sells the “minutas” to the students along with the tamales that she sells to the students, teachers and parents. 

Maria is requesting a loan to improve her business that relies on a large quantity of raw materials. This way she will be able to create more tamales and also to invest in the purchase of ice and flavorful syrups to improve he sales.

loans.use: to purchase ice and flavorful syrups to make and sell minutas.

loans.name: Zafari

texts.ru:
Зафар проживает в городе Дангара. Ему 21 год. Зафар холост. Он живет с родителями. Зафар занимается животноводством. Он в основном разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом бизнеса занимается три года. Кроме того Зафар занимается строительными работами по найму. 
Зафар берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Zafari lives in the city of Dangara. He is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents. For three years he has been working in animal husbandry, mostly raising cattle for future sale. He is additionally employed in construction. Zafari would like this loan to purchase sheep, goats, and cattle.

loans.use: to purchase calves, goats, bulls, and sheep

loans.name: Subhonjon

texts.ru: Субхончон житель города Вахдат. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Субхончон имеет средне – специальное образование. Он более трех лет работает шофером. Кроме того он занимается частным извозом. Субхончон берет кредит для ремонта своего легкового автомобиля и дома.
texts.en: Subhonjon is a 36-year-old married man. He lives in the city of Vahdat and has one child. He has a technical high school diploma. He has been working as a taxi driver for more than three years. He also works as a private chauffer. Subhonjon would like this loan to repair his car and home.

loans.use: to repair his car and home

loans.name: Muhiba

texts.ru: Мухиба родилась в 1969 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж бизнесмен. Дети учатся в школе и университете. Мухиба имеет высшее образование и  работает в школе учителем, но ее зарплата не позволяет ей оплатить за учебы сына в университете, так как ее сын в этом году окончил школу и поступил в  Университет  Российском Федерации. Ее сын очень способный парень. В свободное время читает книги и занимается спортом. Мухиба запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына в университете. Мухиба и ее сын ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhiba was born in 1969. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a businessman. Her children are in school and university. Muhiba has a college education and works as a teacher. However, her son started university this year and her salary is not enough to pay for his tuition. Her son is a very talented boy, who reads and plays sports in his free time. Muhiba would like this loan to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia tiene 46 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Itá, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general en su casa y  a la vez tiene otro en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso hace más de 6 años.
Cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien, ya que ella tiene mucha habilidad para las ventas. Es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de bebidas de todo tipo, como ser cervezas, vinos, whiskys y demás, ya que desea surtir más su negocio que se encuentra en su casa. Además de su trabajo, dice que su marido también lo ayuda mucho.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia is 46 years old and is from the city of Itá. She works selling various drinks from her home, and she has also had another place to sell her drinks in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso for 6 years.

She says that it is going very well, as she is very skilled at selling. She is very hard working and wants to get ahead. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy all kinds of drinks, such as beers, wines, whiskys and others, as she wants to have more stock for the business in her home. She says that in addition to his work, her husband also helps her a lot.

loans.use: to buy various drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Timoteo

texts.es: Nelson de 42 años de edad, es una buena persona, responsable y de excelente moral, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad. Nelson trabaja como sastre en su propio taller de costura donde se encarga de realizar pantalones formales para hombres y niños, como también camisas. Nelson desea que su negocio mejore adquiriendo más trabajo para lo que debe contar con mayor materia prima para elaborar más ropa, por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL  y de este modo poder comprar telas, botones e hilos entre otros más con lo que Nelson asegura podrá obtener mayores ganancias y tener una vida estable junto a su familia.
texts.en: Nelson, who is 42 years old, is a good person, is responsible and of good moral character.  He lives with his wife and three young children.  Nelson owns his own sewing workshop, where he works as a tailor, manufacturing men's and boys' formal trousers and shirts.  Nelson would like to expand his business by taking on more work.  To produce more clothing, he will need more raw materials, which is why he is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fabric, buttons and thread, amongst other things.  Nelson is convinced that this will enable him to increase his profits and allow him and his family to have a stable life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for his business

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María de 58 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y madre responsable, vive junto a un hijo en casa propia. Desde hace 20 años que María posee una venta de frutas y  verduras, el negocio se encuentra en el mercado municipal de su lugar de vivienda, un lugar estratégico y muy bueno para todos los negocios. María  trabaja de lunes a domingo y cuenta con varios clientes fijos, quienes la prefieren por ser muy amable y consiente con los precios de sus productos. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL con el deseo de comprar mayor cantidad de verduras como: repollo, berenjenas,  lechugas, papas, güisquiles, plátanos, guineos, sandias, melones y otros más con lo que podrá tener un negocio más estable y que provea de buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Fifty-eight-year-old María is a hardworking person and a responsible mother.  She lives with one of her sons in her own home.  María has had a fruit and vegetable stand for 20 years.  Her business is in the municipal market in her neighborhood, which is a very good strategic spot for any business.  María works from Monday to Sunday and she has many dedicated customers who prefer her because she is friendly and her produce prices are fair.  Maria is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy more vegetables, such as cabbage, eggplant, lettuce, potatoes, chayote, plantains, bananas, watermelons, and others that will allow her to have a more stable business that makes good profits.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, eggplant, lettuce, and more

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María de 46 años de edad, cuenta con el enorme deseo de superarse y tener un mejor negocio. Ella vive junto a dos hijos, quienes en ocasiones le ayudan con el trabajo en casa. María posee una tienda en la que comercializa bebidas, golosinas, pan, jugos, agua y otros más. Ella cuenta con varios clientes sobretodo personas que transitan en el lugar al igual que vecinos y amigos. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda aumentar la cantidad de productos comestibles y de uso para la limpieza del hogar como también agregar otros nuevos, los cuales le permitan mejorar las ventas, lo cual es su objetivo principal ya que así podrá vivir mejor junto a sus hijos.
texts.en: Forty-six-year-old María has a great desire to better herself and to have a better business.  She lives with two of her children, who sometimes help her with the housework.  María has a store where she sells drinks, candy, bread, juice, water, and more.  She has a good number of customers, mainly people who pass by, as well as friends and neighbors.
