María is asking INTEGRAL for a loan so she can buy more food and home cleaning products and to add other new ones.  This will allow her to improve her sales, which is her main goal, as it will allow her to live better with her children.

loans.use: to buy perishable products for her store

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is 58 year-old Alpha. He is married and has four children aged eight, ten, sixteen and twenty-two. He has three additional dependents who live with him to assist with the business.

In 1996, Alpha established his cooking utensils and plastic products business. He began his business after spending much of his time at the mines with no improvement; he wanted to be self reliant to meet his family's needs. His business is located in a busy market area and his main customers are visitors to the market (adults, especially women). Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,518,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. 

Alpha has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy rubber bowls, plastic shopping baskets, flasks, and drinking cups. He hopes that this loan can help in increasing his stock. 

In the future, Alpha plans to expand his business at the outskirts of town. He also hopes to be able to take care of his children's education. The loan can improve his sales and thus increase profits. He thanks ARD for the support. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for rubber bowls, a plastic shopping basket, flasks, and drinking cups.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María de 50 años de edad, vive junto a un hijo con quien comparte los gastos del hogar. María posee una tienda a la entrada de su casa de habitación en la que comercializa productos diversos tanto alimenticios como para el uso del hogar, ella es una persona muy trabajadora quien quiere lo mejo para su vida y la de su hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo  a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para la tienda, lo que le permita tener más clientes fijos, lo cual es muy bueno para todo negocio  estable. María desea mucho fortalecer su negocio con más productos ya que es esto lo que le ayudará a percibir más ganancias y contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en: María, 50, lives with her son with whom she splits household costs. María owns a store located in the front part of her living quarters from which she sells a variety of groceries and household items. She is a very hardworking person who wants the best for her and her childrens' lives. She is requesting a loan from Integral to invest in the purchase of large quantities of products for the store which would allow her to have more regular customers, a very good thing for any stable business. María very much hopes to strengthen her business with more products since this is what will help her to make a bigger profit and have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos, es ganadero, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijos, su negocio en la ganadería empezó por el apoyo de sus padres, trabaja solo, no tiene un horario establecido.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos vacas, las cuales le interesa adquirirlas para aumentar su hato ganadero, esto le permitirá mejorar y trabajar creciendo en su número de ganado.
Su aspiración es tener casa propia, dar el estudio a sus hijos y apoyar en lo más necesario.
texts.en:
Carlos is a rancher.  He lives with his family, his wife and children.  He started his cattle business with the help of his parents.  He works alone and doesn't have a set schedule.

He's requesting a loan to buy two cows.  He's interested in buying them to increase his cattle herd, which will allow him to improve and to work with a growing number of cattle.

His goals are to have his own house and to give his children an education, supporting them with the most necessary things.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Tania De Los Angeles

texts.es: Tania de los Ángeles de 31 anos de edad, casada con tres hijos de 14, 8,2 todos menores de edad, están estudia diado.  Tania es  originaria del departamento de Chinandega. Ella tiene por actividad económica la el servicio de cibercafé, y juegos de nintendo, tiene 4 anos de tener el negocio. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. El negocio consisten en servicios de fotocopiadora, servicios de llamadas telefónicas, renta los jugos videos. Nintendo. Donde ella misma administra su negocio. la rutina diaria de esta mujer es una 10 horas diarias, ofreciendo su servicio a su clientela. El negocio lo inicio al verse sin trabajo fijo, decidió comprar al crédito televisores y Nintendos. Y con los ingresos pudo comprar computadores para poner el cibercafé, llamadas y fotocopiadoras. Tania ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo  y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar una computadora y darles mantenimientos a los equipos ya existentes para brindar un buen servicio. Tania de los Ángeles agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Tania de Los Ángeles, age 31, is married and has three children (ages 14, 8, and 2). All of them are enrolled in school. Tania is originally from the Department of Chinandega. She has a cybercafé where she offers Internet services and Nintendo games. Her business has been in existence for four years and is located in her home. She also provides photocopy services, phone services, and Nintendo video game rentals in the same location. Her daily routine consists of working 10 hours a day as she offers her services to her customers.

Tania started her business because she did not have a steady job. She decided to buy television sets and Nintendo consoles. With the profits she earned, Tania was able to buy computers for setting up a cybercafé, and also to begin offering calling and photocopy services. She is already working with Fundación León 2000 and has demonstrated that she is responsible in submitting her payments on time and according to the terms.

The loan she needs will be invested as operating capital toward the purchase of a computer and the maintenance of her existing equipment so that she can provide good service. Tania de Los Ángeles is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a decent source of work.

loans.use: to buy a computer and to pay for maintenance of her existing equipment.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina continua con su negocio de venta de artesania como aretes (plateria),la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia actualmente esta administrando un hotel por el centro de la ciudad siendo este un trabajo que le gusta y le trae satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 
La socia solicita el credito para aumentar su mercaderia de plateria como collares y anillos.


La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member, Marcelina, continues with her business selling silver handicrafts such as earrings.  She has been in this business for some time, and it's going well for her because of the effort she puts into it every day.

Currently she's managing a hotel in the center of town.  She likes this job and it brings her financial and personal satisfaction.  She's a responsible and hardworking person, this being how she gets her family ahead.

She's requesting the loan to increase her silver merchandise, such as necklaces and rings.

She's grateful for this opportunity and pledges to make her payments in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: to buy necklaces and rings

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es: María de 48 años, vive junto a su madre, su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee un negocio en el que se dedica a elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, su comedor se encuentra ubicado en el mercado municipal, lo que es muy bueno para ella, ya que las personas que tienen sus puestos en el mismo lugar le comprar alimentos a diario, así mismo personas que llegan a comprar al mercado. Sus alimentos son muy sabrosos e higiénicos por lo que  sus clientes se encuentran muy satisfechos con su trabajo. María solicita un préstamo para poder comprar: verduras, carnes, mariscos, granos básicos, frutas, especias y otros ingredientes más para la elaboración de un menú más amplio que satisfaga los deseos de sus clientes y de esta forma establecer mejor su negocio.
texts.en: María, 48, lives with her mother, husband, and two minor children who are attending school. She owns a business in which she devotes herself to preparing breakfasts and lunches. Her eatery is located in the city market which is very good for her since the people who have their stalls in the same place buy food from her on a daily basis, as well as the people who come to the market to shop. Her food is quite delicious and sanitary and so her customers are highly satisfied with her work. María is requesting a loan in order to purchase vegetables, meat, seafood, basic staples, fruit, spices and other ingredients for making a more extensive menu that would satisfy her customers' wishes and so fortify her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, seafood and other items for her business.

loans.name: Ranulfo Antonio

texts.es: Ranulfo de 36 años de edad, es una persona creativa y muy dedicada a lo que hace para ganarse la vida, vive junto a su esposa y un pequeño hijo menor de edad. Ranulfo se dedica a elaborar artesanías en madera, tejas, cuadros y otros más, los cuales realiza con pinturas acrílicas y otros productos para embellecer las imágenes, él desea dar siempre lo mejor de si por lo que es muy detallista en los trabajos que realiza, lo que le permite contar con muchos clientes. Ranulfo solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar diferentes figuras de madera, litografías, pinceles, pinturas de distintos colores y otras herramientas más para la elaboración de las artesanillas y así hacer crecer su negocio como tanto lo ha deseado. Así mismo invertirá en la construcción de una pequeña galería en el patio de su casa para colocar todos sus trabajos y que sea más fácil mostrárselo a sus clientes. Él es muy alegre y trabajador y siempre tiene una actitud muy positiva y muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ranulfo is 36 years old. He is a creative person who is very dedicated to what he does to earn a living. He lives with his wife and a little son who is a minor. Ranulfo makes handicrafts in wood, tile, paintings, and other items, which he makes with acrylic paints and other products to embellish the images. He always wants to give the best of himself, and so he is very detail-oriented in the work that he does, which allows him to have many customers. 

Ranulfo is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to purchase different wooden figures, lithographs, brushes, paints in different colors, and other tools to make his handicrafts and thus make his business grow as he has so much wanted to. At the same time, he will invest in the construction of a little gallery on the patio of his house so that he can gather all his work and it will be easier to show it to his customers. He is very happy and hard-working and he always has a very positive attitude and a great will to advance.

loans.use: to buy paints and wood to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Tania Isabel

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria pollos ella los hace engordar y crecer y luego los lleva a los diferentes ferias o mercados y los vende,la socia tambien sigue siendo profesora del nivel primario,por medio de su trabajo y su negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,la socia ya tiene 6 años en el negocio de crianza de animales,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member still has her business raising animals.  She raises chickens; she fattens them as they grow and then she takes them to different markets and she sells them.  She is also still a primary school teacher.  Through this work and her business, she is getting her son ahead.  She has had her livestock business for six years now and her dream is to have a space where she could sell her chickens.  She is asking for a loan to buy chickens and chicken feed.

She is happy with her loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Amelia De Jesus

texts.es: Amelia de 47 años de edad, es una persona con muchos deseos de salir adelante y vivir mejor, ella vive sola en su casa de habitación mismo lugar en el que tiene su negocio, el cual es una tienda de productos de primera necesidad como: pan, bebidas, productos enlatados y congelados, lácteos, golosinas y otros más, hasta el momento su venta ha sido estable, lo cual desea mejorar considerablemente,  Amelia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de golosinas, especias, bebidas, diferentes tipos de pan, comida para perros y gatos y otros productos más los cuales beneficiarán su tienda haciéndola más fuerte, la cual entre en la preferencia de las personas y sea la primera opción para comprar lo necesario para el hogar.
texts.en:
Amelia is 47 years old and very much wants to get ahead and improve her life. She lives alone in her house, the same place where she has her business. She has a shop selling essentials like bread, drinks, frozen and canned products, dairy products, sweets and more.

Until her sales have become stable, which she wants to considerably improve, Amelia is asking for a loan from Apoyo Integral, with which she can have the necessary money to be able to buy bigger quantities of sweets, spices, drinks, different types of bread, dog and cat food and other products. This will benefit her shop by making it stronger so that people prefer her shop and it is the first choice for buying what they need for their home.

loans.use: to buy sweets, spices, drinks and other products.

loans.name: Alfredo Tomas

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de gaseosas,el socio vende en forma independiente llevando a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes,el socio tambien sigue haciendo el negocio de transporte,el tiene un carro que hace servicio de transporte,por medio de sus negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de gaseosas.El socio solicita el credito para comprar gaseosas al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to devote himself to selling soft drinks. He makes his sales independently, delivering the product to a number of grocery stores. The member also continues working in the transportation business. He has a car by which he provides transportation services. Through his businesses the member supports his children. The member has had this business seven years and it's going very well for him. The member's dream is to expand the soft drink business. The member is seeking the loan for purchasing soft drinks wholesale. 

The member is happy to receive the loan and commits to making his payments.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks wholesale.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y fgalletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche,galletas y aceite.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member still has her grocery store.  She sells essential items, such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m..  She has had her business for eight years now and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, cookies, and oil.

She is happy with her loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, cookies, and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for soft drinks, recharge cards, and Ovaltine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic shoes

loans.name: Adiatu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Adiatu. She is married and has 2 children aged 15 and 12. They are both in school. In 2006, Adiatu established her clothing and footwear business. She began her business after the war; she went to Freetown where she started doing small trading at home. After two years her husband sent her money to relocate to Makeni and open a permanent business. Though she was not doing business before this time, she was able to acquire good business techniques from her friends. She works hard in order to develop her business and she has supported her family through the years. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,771,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. Adiatu requires a loan in order to purchase 2 bails of English wax (light cotton fabric printed with a West African design made using a wax-printing process) at a price of le 3,000,000 each. In the future, Adiatu plans to open another outlet for African ready-made designed clothing. Her challenges are changes in foreign exchange rates. 

Adiatu is hard-working and committed to her business and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy fabric to sell in her clothing store

loans.name: Maxwell M

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Maxwell. He is single and has no children. In 2007, Maxwell established an office supply business. He began his business because he dropped out of school through a lack of sponsorship. He joined his uncle's business, and after some years his uncle gave him some money to start selling shoes. He maintained the business for some time and later changed the business to stationery. 

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,500,000 every month. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. He requires a loan to buy A4 paper, cartridges, office trays, paper files, and ledger books for Le 4,800,000, and the balance of Le200,000 will be used for transport. 

In the future, Maxwell plans to become a supplier, build a house, buy a car and open different outlets. This loan will help to develop his business. He is a hardworking business man. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy more office supplies

loans.name: Superando Group

texts.es:
Alex tiene 32 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo, reside en una comunidad rural del municipio de Atima Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la producción de granos básicos (maíz y frijoles) para el autoconsumo. Hace 5 años que se dedica a cultivar café para la venta a intermediarios.
En este momento ha solicitado un préstamo grupal el cual piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar la finca de café.
Con el apoyo financiero lograra obtener una mejor cosecha, lo cual le motiva a seguir produciendo y ampliando su área de cultivo. Su meta a largo plazo es superarse económicamente y lograr lo necesario para que su familia viva bien.
Alex pertenece al grupo solidario denominado “Superando”, dicho grupo está conformado por 6 personas que en la foto se identifican de la siguiente manera: de las personas de pie de izquierda a derecha esta melvin, Rogelio, Daniel y Adalberto; de las personas agachadas a la izquierda esta Alber y a la derecha esta Alex (Coordinador del grupo).
Todos los integrantes se dedican a la producción y venta de café en pergamino húmedo, además residen en la misma comunidad y utilizaran el préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes.
El préstamo total Grupal es de 33,000 Lempiras y de manera individual 5,500 Lempiras cada uno.
texts.en:
Alex is 32 years old, married, and has one child. He resides in a rural community in the town of Atima in the Department of Santa Barbará. Alex previously cultivated basic grains, such as corn and beans, for personal consumption. Five years ago, he began cultivating coffee that he could sell to brokers. At the moment, he is participating in a group loan request and will invest his share in the purchase of fertilizers for his coffee farm. With the financial support he will receive, Alex will be able to achieve a better harvest. This will motivate him to continue producing and expanding his crops. His long-term goal is to succeed financially and provide what his family needs to live well.

Alex is a member of the solidarity group named “Superando” (Excelling), which consists of six individuals who appear in the photo. The members seen standing, from left to right, are Melvin, Rogelio, Daniel, and Adalberto. The gentlemen who are seated are Alber on the left and Alex on the right (who is also the group coordinator).

All of the members produce and sell wet parchment coffee. They reside in the same community and will use their respective loans to purchase fertilizers. The total group loan amounts to 33,000 HNL and each member will receive 5,500 HNL.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Juana De Mata

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz,papa y verduras,la socia trabaja en su terreno de cultivo donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de terreno de cultivo.Ls socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y abonos.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá D. manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member continues to devote herself to farming. She has a plot of farmland where she grows corn, potatoes and vegetables. She works in her fields from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. She has had this business eight years and it's going very well for her. The member's dream is to expand her farming business. The member is seeking the loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. 

The member is appreciative and wishes to state that she will be disciplined about making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Apolinar; el socio continua con su negocio de venta de colchones,el socio lleva años en  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,a la vez el socio continua con su otro negocio de tienda de abarrotes el vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como arroz y leche para la tienda de abarrotes.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This man is a member of the Valle Sagrado de Calca Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the district of Calca, which belongs to the province of Calca in the department of Cusco.

This communal bank member is Apolinar.  He still has his business selling mattresses.  He has had his business for years and it is going well for him because of the effort he puts into it every day.  He also still has his other business selling groceries.  He sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar, candy, and soft drinks, among others.  He is a responsible and hardworking person, which is how he gets his family ahead. 

He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise, such as rice and milk, for his grocery store.

He is happy with his loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as rice and milk, for his grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food items for his business, such as vegetable oil, rubber, eggs, and potatoes.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has one child, aged 8. In 2005, Salamatu established her business of selling cloth. She began her business just to empower herself. Her business is located in the heart of town, and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 300,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock, 1,500,000 SLL worth of wax cotton, and 1,500,000 SLL worth of local cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to start traveling to Guinea for business. Salamatu plans to move from her current location to a more attractive one, and also to secure a plot of land, in the future. She is saying thanks to Kiva

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her shop

loans.name: Ishmail

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Ishmail. He is married and has three children aged 30, 25 and 15 years. All of them go to school. In 1965, Ishmail established his blacksmith business. He began his business because he had learnt this trade from his elder brother. They were not  fortunate enough to go to school due to lack of finance Their parents were poor farmers. His brother and he had to process and sell pots, knives and hoes to sustain the family. 

Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 234,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to purchase 600 kilos of aluminum for LE 3,000,000. 

In the future, Ishmail plans to expend his business and to open a showroom to display his goods. He is a hardworking business man. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more tools for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Jemilatu

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Jemilatu. She is married and has two children aged 7 and 9 years. Both are school-going children. 

In 2010, Jemilatu established her ladies' shoe business. She began her business because she was not privileged to attend school as her parents did not value girls' education. She used to assist her aunt with business. Knowing her background, her husband gave her some amount of money to start business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,600,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy ladies' shoes and sandals (costing 2,800,000), and 200,000 SLL will be used for transportation. 

In the future, Jemilatu plans to provide quality education for her children, open a shop, and build a house. The loan will help to accomplish some of her future plans. Competition is high, but with adequate help she will be able to lead in the market. She is a hard-working business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more ladies' shoes.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de picanteria,ella vende gaseosas y cervezas y tambien comida como pollo al horno,cuy al horno y sopas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de picanteria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucila is still dedicated to her restaurant business, selling soft drinks, beers and also food such as roast chicken, roast guinea pig and soups. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, and has worked for 6 years in this business, which is going very well.

Lucila's dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy ingredients to cook with such as meat, chicken and vegetables. Lucila is happy about this loan, and is committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Adama K

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Adama. She is married and has three children ages 14, 12 and 10.  All are school-going children. In 2005, Adama established her provisions and beverages business. She began her business because she married early because her parents did not think it necessary to send a girl child to school. When she gave birth to her second child, her husband decided to set up a small business. 

Working six days a week and 17 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,417,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 6,000,000 to purchase food to sell. Adama has already received and successfully repaid one loan.

In the future, Adama plans to expand her business and support her children's education. It will help a lot, as it is can be in addition to the income from her business. Competition and changes in demand of the customers are her major problems. She is hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu M

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has three children ages 18, 15 and 12.  All are school-going children. In 2004, Kadiatu established her clothing business. She began it because her parents were illiterate, and they did not know the value of education. Her mother was a trader who taught her that a woman’s job is to care for the family. She joined her in her trading. Within a few years she learned a lot and set up her own business. 

Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,449,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000 to purchase clothing to sell. In the future, Kadiatu plans open a boutique and education her children. She is hard working and committed to her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú¡¡¡ Este es el grupo “Las Hormiguitas” conformada por 08 mujeres entusiastas y trabajadoras que por medios de sus negocios han logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias, siendo Julia la que preside al grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad. Ella tiene 51 años de edad casada con 04 hijos, actualmente  sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos.  La señora Julia se dedica a la venta comida, en un puesto de mercado, lleva trabajando de esta manera hace más de 25 años. Julia nos comenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes. El crédito que solicito lo destinará compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, leche y de esta manera atender bien a sus comensales. Su mayor deseo es de contar con un puesto propio, ya que por el momento lo alquila. El grupo “Las Hormiguitas” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso.  Julia está ubicada en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo color azul.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!!! This is the "Las Hormiguitas" [Little Ants] group made up of eight enthusiastic and hardworking women who through their businesses have achieved a better quality of life for their families. Julia is the group's president, a job she has carried out responsibly. She is 51 years old, married and has four children of whom she continues to support two. Ms. Julia earns a living selling prepared foods out of a market stall. She has been working in this line of business for 25 years. Julia tells us that she has developed a loyal following of customers. 

The loan she is seeking is intended for the purchase of supplies such as rice, sugar and milk so as to serve her diners well. Her greatest wish is to have her own stall since at the moment she is renting. The "Las Hormiguitas" group appreciates the loan they have been given since it makes their progress possible. Julia is located in the back row, second from the left, and is wearing a blue top.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Mayamu

texts.en:
Mayamu, 30, is single with two children, ages 6 and 9, who are currently in school.

Mayamu is a university student. For the past seven years, she has been managing her business since she is the only source of income for her children.

A difficulty she faces is having fewer commodities. She sells sardines, rice, cooking oil, Vita, bath soap and lunch meat. She is very proud of this business because she is self-reliant. She makes profits when she sells and with the profits she buys more goods and attends to her children's needs.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sardines, lunch meat, Vita, cooking oil and bath soap to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to build a decent house.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, lunch meat, Vita, cooking oil and bath soap to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sento M.

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Sento. She is married and has three children aged 6, 8, and 11 years. All are school-going children. 

In 2008, Sento established her mayonnaise, Ovaltine, milk, air freshener, luncheon meat, onions, rice, and sugar business. She began her business because she didn't attend school because her parents did not value girls' education. Her mother only introduced her to business. 

When she got married, her husband gave her some amount of money to start a business. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 1,800,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Sento would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy flour (4 bags at 120,000 each), sugar (5 bags at 120,000 each), rice (3 bags at 130,000 each), soap (4 cartons at 250,000 each), and sachet milk (6 packets at 85,000 each).The balance of 20,000 SLL will be used for transportation. 

In the future, Sento plans to build a house and provide quality education for her children, as well as expand the business. The loan will help to accomplish some of her future plans. Sometime items like biscuits will get broken when travelling with them. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, rice, soap, and milk for her business.

loans.name: Jonny  Antonio

texts.es:
Jonny tiene la edad de 27 años de edad, casado, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos maíz y frijol. Es un cliente Kiva. Jonny muestra su agradecimiento a Kiva y MiCrédito, por el apoyo brindado por el préstamo otorgado, ya que trajo muchos cambios a su vida y su negocio, dinero que pudo invertir en la siembra obteniendo mejor rendimiento en su cosecha y de esta manera poder obtener mayor producción en su siembra. 
Jonny solicita el préstamo para pago de mano de obra y compra de insumo para el mantenimiento de su siembra de maíz y frijoles, ya que esto le ayudara a darle una mejor asistencia a sus siembras y asi obtener  una  producción de calidad y buenos rendimientos para su venta.
texts.en: Jonny is 27 years old, married, and he is a farmer by trade.  He grows the staple grains of corn and beans for a living.  He is a Kiva client.  Jonny would like to express his thanks to Kiva and MiCrédito for the help he received through the loan he was granted, as it has brought many changes to to his life and business.  He was able to invest that money in his planting, which resulted in a better yield from his harvest, which means he is getting better production from his planting.  Jonny is asking for a loan to pay laborers and to buy supplies to maintain his corn and bean crops, as this will help him take better care of his crops and thereby get quality produce and good returns on his sales.

loans.use: to pay laborers and to buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from AVON to resell

loans.name: Matriatu

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Mariatu. She is married and has three children ages 18,15 and 12 years. All are school-going children. She has one additional dependent who lives with her so she can go to school and help with domestic work. In 1981, Mariatu established her local produce (beans, garri, benny) business. She began her business because she was not fortunate enough to go to school. Her parents were traders, whom she used to help in the market. She learnt a lot from her mother's business. She helped her to set up her own business and through the years her business has developed gradually. 

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 967,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000 to purchase palm oil and beans and for transport. In the future, Mariatu plans to build a house and send her children to college. She is hard-working and committed to her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more household utensils.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia Valentina  tiene 49 años,es casada y tiene 3 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de cereales,la socia vende tarwi,quinua,trigo y moraya,la socia vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia tiene 6 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tarwi,trigo,quinua y moraya.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos.
texts.en:
Valentina, 49, is married and has 3 children.  She has a business selling cereals.  She sells tarwi (a native Andean grain), quinoa, wheat and freeze-dried potatoes.  She sells in the market from 8am until 5pm.  Valentina has had this business for 6 years, and she dreams of expanding her grain business.  Valentina is requesting a loan to buy tarwi, wheat, quinoa and dried potatoes.

Valentina is pleased to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy tarwi, wheat, quinoa and dried potatoes

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 27 años, es un hombre trabajador, honesto y muy responsable, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres junto a ellos, quienes son su principal motivo de mucho trabajo y sacrificio. El trabajo de Antonio consiste básicamente en la venta de zapatos y sandalias. Trabaja en forma ambulante, ofreciendo sus productos en uno de los principales mercados de su ciudad y gracias a su gran afluencia puede tener buenas ventas durante el día. Asimismo tiene un puesto de ventas en donde ofrece toda su mercadería de manrea estable. Lleva en este negocio más de 6 años y complementa esta labor con la venta de prductos de primera necesidad, que también vende en su puesto de venta de calzados y poco a poco esta incrementando. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la fluidez de sus ventas que se traducen en buenas ganancias, además siempre está compartiendo bueno momentos con sus compañeros de trabajo en el mercado y eso le ayuda a laborar siempre con una sonrisa, le está yendo bien ya que vende mucho y ya se está preparando para la temporada navideña. Este es el préstamo número 1 con MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues se lleva bien con todos sus miembros a los que considera buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por sandalias femeninas en diversos modelos y variados colores.
texts.en: Twenty-seven-year-old Antonio is a hardworking, honest, and very responsible man.  He is single and does not have any children yet.  He lives with his parents, who are his main reason to work hard and sacrifice.  Antonio's work basically consists of selling shoes and sandals.  He works on foot, selling his products in one of the city's main markets and, thanks to the market's huge crowds, he is able to make good sales during the day.  He also has a stall where he sells all of his merchandise in a set place.  He has had this business for over six years and he supplements this work by selling necessities, which he also sells at his shoe stand and which he is increasing little by little.  What he likes most about his work is the ease with which his sales translate into good profits.  Additionally, he always has a good time with his coworkers at the market and that helps him work with a smile.  His business is going well as he is selling a lot and he is already getting ready for the holiday season.  This is his first loan with MFP and he is thankful for the financial support they are offering him so that he can achieve his goals.  He is also very comfortable with his communal bank as he gets along with all of its members, whom he considers to be good people.  With the requested 800 soles, he will buy more merchandise, such as different kinds and colors of women's sandals.

loans.use: to buy women's sandals

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has 4 children aged 18, 16,14, and 12. All are school-going. In 1997, Kadiatu established her plastic bowls and enameled pans business. She began this business because her parents were traders and when she grew up her parents thought it better for her to join their trade instead of wasting money to send her to school. As far as they were concerned she could only achieve if she learned a trade. She had no option but to join the family business, since she had no relatives to help her. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 376,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase 15 big plastic bowls at a price of Le 20,000 each (Le 1,000,000), 20 big enameled pans at a price of Le 50,000 (Le 1,000,000), and 25 drinking buckets at a price of Le 20,000 each (Le 500,000). She will use the remaining Le 500,000 to purchase washing buckets.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls and enameled pans

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Isata. She is married and has one child, aged 16 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is her late sister's child.  Isata is assisting her niece with her education. In 2002 Isata established her business, selling hair products, jeans, and blouses. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant, after graduating from a technical school. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her customers are both ladies and gents. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about 1,450,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Isata has previously received, and successfully repaid, two loans. Now she requires a new loan in order to buy more hair products. She hopes that this loan can improve on her hair product sales. Isata plans to move the shop to the center of town and improve the boutique, in the future. The loan can improve her sales and maximize her profit. Isata says: "I thank ARD for the support." She thanks you, also, for your support.

loans.use: to pay for hair products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina;la socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de gaseosas,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia distribuye su mercaderia a sus clientes que mas le solicitan como tiendas de abarrotes,depositos de bebidas entre otros,la socia a la vez continua trabajando como docente del nivel secundario siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de gaseosas al por mayor para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Valle Sagrada de Calca" located in the district of Calca belonging to the Calca province and Cusco department. 

The member is Ms. Cristina who continues with her business buying and selling soft drinks. The member has been in this line of a business for a good while and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. The member distributes her merchandise to her customers who request it such as grocery stories and beverage warehouse stores among others. At the same time the member continues to work on the teaching staff at a secondary school and in this way she supports her family. 

The member is seeking the loan to purchase soft drinks wholesale for her business. She is happy to receive the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks wholesale for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.es: Alice, tiene la edad  de 48 años, está casa,  vive con sus hijos y esposo. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y pagar mano de obra para la reparación de su casa, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que quiere es poder comprar los mejores materiales de buena calidad para que su casa quede en buen estado y así mejorar su calidad de vida.  Con las mejoras a su vivienda espera tener un mejor lugar para vivir y que sus hijos puedan crecer en mejores condiciones. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alice is 48-years-old and is married. She lives with her children and her husband. With the loan she tries to purchase wood and pay for the workforce to repair her home and hereby ensure good work. She wants to be able to buy the best materials of good quality so that her home is in a good state. This will improve her quality of life. With the improvements to her home she hopes to have a better place to live and that her children can grow up in better conditions. 

This is the first loan the she received. She had not received other loans from state banks, but now a loan has been offered to her with better facilities and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to improve her home

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es: La Sra. Juana  tiene 53 años casada con un hijo de 17 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida ella vende patasca que es una sopa tradicional de las zonas alto andinas. Proviene del quechua phatasqa, que significa reventado o partido, porque la elaboración está lista cuando en el hervor el maíz se abre. Es una poderosa sopa de alto nivel nutritivo, por el concentrado de las vísceras de res, la cabeza del carnero, las papas, habas, maíz y demás especias. Esta comida se inicia desde el día anterior al consumo por el trajín de la preparación (muchas veces de manera grupal), y en algunos lugares de la sierra se le suele llamar también sopa de mote, sopa de mondongo o mondongo ella tiene  su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de la Guardia, empezó a trabajar con su mama desde muy pequeña, este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Juana va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como maíz y papa para la elaboración de la patasca, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, la Sra. Juana  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana, 53, is married and has a 17-year-old son. She devotes herself to selling prepared foods including "patasca" which is a traditional soup from the Andean highlands. The name comes from the quechuan word "phatasqa" which means split or burst, because the food is ready once the kernels of corn that are being boiled open up. It is a powerful soup of great nutritional value on account of the concentrate made from beef innards, ram's heads, potatoes, beans, corn and various spices. This food is begun the day before it is consumed because of its complicated preparation (often done as a group) and in some parts of the mountains it is often called "sopa de mote," "sopa de mondongo" or "mondongo." She has her sales post which is located in the town of Guardia. She began working with her mom when she was quite little. 

This loan is her third with the institution. Ms. Juana will use this loan to purchase ingredients such as corn and potatoes for making patasaca. Her reason for seeking this loan is to continue improving in her work. Ms. Juana is a very hardworking person and is happy about the opportunity of having the loan because this business is her only means of supporting herself.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as corn and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional inventory, including phone recharge cards, to resell in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Dunia

texts.es: Dunia, tiene la edad  de 27 años, está casada, vive con sus hijos y esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembras y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Dunia is 27 years old and is married.  She lives with her children and husband, who are her main priority.  With this loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and to pay for labor to help with her coffee crops.  In addition, she will buy some coffee seedlings to replant and expand the density of her plantings per area; this way she can take advantage of the good fertility of the soil and the climatic and other conditions that favor the cultivation of coffee.  

With these improvements, she hopes to increase her earnings a bit, thereby improving living conditions for her family.  She also hopes to invest more to expand the area of her cultivations, and to achieve some other goals. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She had not taken prior loans with the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her with a loan with easier terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to grow more coffee

loans.name: Neida

texts.es:
Neida, tiene 44 años, es una mujer honesta y muy trabajadora, convive con su pareja y tiene 3 hijos de 26, 23 y 18 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su propia vivienda. El trabajo de Neida consiste en la confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, se encarga con suma paciencia de elaborar las prendas que sus clientes le solicitan de manera particular y con frecuencia algunas prendas que ella misma crea. Algunas de ellas las pone a la venta en un pequeño espacio dentro de su casa. Se dedica a éste trabajo más de 15 años, siempre ha trabajado sola y afirma que nunca tuvo algún reclamo por parte de sus clientes ya que siempre ha visto la manera de cumplir con su demanda. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar sus diseños en prendas de vestir y eso la motiva mucho a continuar trabajando, espera pronto construir un taller de costura mucho mas grande y destinar un espacio únicamente para la venta de sus creaciones. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000), comprará cierta cantidad de telas, hilos, elásticos, botones, cierres y otros accesorios que necesita para confeccionar algunas prendas que pondrá a la venta.
texts.en:
44 year old Neida is an honest and hardworking woman. She lives with her partner and has 3 children of 26, 23, and 18 years of age. They live together in their own home. Neida works making clothes for women, men and children. She works with great patience to make the custom clothes that her clients order and also often makes clothes to her own design. She sells some of these in a small space in her home. She has been doing this work for more than 15 years and has always worked alone and says that she has never had a client ask for their money back as she has always been able to meet their needs. What she likes about her work is that she can translate her designs into clothes to be worn and this motivates her greatly to continue working. She hopes to build a much bigger workshop soon so that she can have a space to use solely for selling her creations. This will be her second loan from MFP and she is grateful to all the people who make her loan possible so that she can keep doing her work with better results. She is glad to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and very united. 
She will use the funds that she is requesting ($400) to buy a certain quantity of fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, closures and other accessaries that are necessary for making clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, closures, and other accessories needed for making clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Mary. She is divorced and has two children, aged 12 and 15. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to assist a sister. In 2004 Mary established her business, selling cooking utensils, shirts, suit cases, jeans, and shoes. She began her business out of the need to be self-reliant, after being devastated by the war. 

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,900,000 SLL every month from her business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Mary requires a new loan in order to add more cooking utensils to her inventory.

Mary plans to expand the shop with the sale of soft drinks, and open a shop at the center of town, in the future. The loan can increase the profit that can be used for expansion. Mary thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for cooking utensils to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for used textiles to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of rice to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 52 años está casado con Furora. Ambos tienen solo un hijo, pero ya no vive con ellos. Víctor y su esposa habitan un hogar propio ubicado en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Víctor es un hombre sabio y alegre. Se dedica a la agricultura con la producción de muchos frutos, pero da prioridad al café y achiote ya que los otros le sirven de alimentos, casi siempre.
“Tengo 4 chacras de café, el año pasado coseché 20 sacos y este año será igual”, menciona. Víctor vende cada saco de 70 kilos a 120 soles, por eso, cada año se esmera en el cuidado de las plantas, para que las enfermedades más comunes como: la “arañera” y el “ojo de gallo”, no malogren las hojas y granos del café.
Así también, la siembra de achiote es rentable, porque la demanda del producto se da en todo el año. 
Hace un año empezó con la elaboración de viveros de café y ya los tiene listos para plantarlos. Por ello requiere de mano de obra. Solicita de su apoya, para alcanzar esta meta de corto plazo. Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP. Se siente satisfecho trabajando con su banco comunal “Los productores de Inchatingari”, por la solidaridad y por los intereses en común de sus integrantes. Dice que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Con los 1000 soles podrá pagar al personal que plante los viveros de café que tiene, asimismo comprará bolsas de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Victor is 52 years old and is married to Furora. They have only one child who no longer lives with them. Victor and his wife live in a house they own located in a rural community in the central jungle. Victor is a wise and cheerful man. He works in agriculture, in the production of many fruits, but gives priority to coffee and achiote as the others will serve for food, almost always. 

“I have 4 small coffee fields, last year I harvested 20 sacks and this year will be the same” he says. Victor sells each bag of 70 kilos for 120 Peruvian soles, so, each year he strives to care for the plants, so that the most common diseases such as coffee-leaf rot and rooster’s eye fungus, don’t ruin the leaves and coffee beans.

As well, achiote planting is profitable because demand for the product is throughout the year.

A year ago he began with the development of coffee nurseries and he now has them ready to plant. He requires labour. He is requesting support to achieve this short term goal. This is his 4th credit with MFP. He feels pleased working with his communal bank “Los productores de Inchatingan” (Inchatingan Growers) for the support and the common interests of its members. He says he will pay the monthly installments on time. With the 1000 Peruvian Soles he will be able to pay the staff who plant the coffee nurseries he has, as well as buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to contract day labourers and purchase bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Freddy Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr. Freddy  tiene 30 años tiene un hijo de la edad de 4 añitos, el se dedica a la venta de CDs y VDs de músicas y películas, se dedica a esta actividad hace ya 3 años el tiene su tienda donde ofrece sus productos en  la populosa zona de Villa Primero de Mayo, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Freddy va a usar este préstamo para la compra de DVs y Cds de música y películas para surtir su tienda,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la compra de estos productos, el Sr. Freddy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existen varios lugares donde ofrecen películas y músicas, pero no se puede quejar ya que tiene clientela y utilizara los beneficios en la compra de mas productos para surtir su tienda, el Sr. Freddy es una persona muy trabajadora esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene,  se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: 30 year old Freddy has a little son who is four years old. He works selling CDs and DVDs of music and movies. He has been doing this for 3 years. He has his store in the busy area of Villa Primero de Mayo in the city of Santa Cruz. This loan will be his first with the Institution. Freddy is going to use this loan to buy DVDs and CDs of music and movies to stock his store. His reason for requesting this loan is that he doesn't have enough money to buy these products. Freddy faces challenges in his business, particularly competition as there are a number of places in the area that sell movies and music. But, he can't complain as he has customers and will use the benefits to buy more products to supply his store. Freddy is a very hardworking person and this is the only job he has to support himself. He feels happy and grateful for the opportunity offered to him.

loans.use: to buy music and video CDs/DVDs.

loans.name: Yeaba

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Yeaba. She is married and has 2 children aged 20 and 15. Both are in school. In 2000, Yeaba established her bar and restaurant. She began her business because she was going to school when the war broke out. After the rebel war she was not able to continue her education. She had no option but to get married to her boyfriend. He helped her enter into a vocation program where she was trained to be a caterer. After her graduation her husband helped her with some amount of money that she used to open a restaurant. 

Working 6 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 469,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Yeaba has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy 10 crates of Heineken for Le120,000 each (Le 1,200,000),  8 crates of Carlsberg at Le 120,000 each (Le 960,000),  5 crates of canned soft drinks at Le70,000 each (Le 350,000), and 5 crates of maltina at Le 90,000 each (Le 450,000). The remaining Le 40,000 will be used for transportation. In the future, Yeaba plans to open a boutique and support her children's education. Competition is high, but with enough goods she is able to lead in the market. She is committed to her business.  Yeaba needs more capital and with help of the credit service, she knows she will achieve. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Alieu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Alieu. He is married and has 2 school-going children aged 10 and 6. In 2004, Alieu established his provisions (milk, Ovaltine, sugar, toiletries) business. He began his business because he was not fortunate enough to go to school because his father does not value education and also the tribe that he comes from are known to be traders and cattle rearers.

Alieu grew up rearing cattle. After the war a friend forced him to move to the big town (Makeni town) where he started a peddling business which has improved over the years. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 567,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Alieu requires a loan in order to purchase phone cards (50,000,000 units @ Le 38,000 = Le 1,900,000), milk (25 pieces @ Le 20,000 = Le 500,000), bathing soap (5 cartons @ Le 60,000 = Le 300,000), sugar (2 bags @ Le 260,000 = Le 520,000), Bond Steet cigarettes (1carton @ Le 1,000,000), Gold Seal Cigarettes (1 carton @ Le 600,000), and toothpaste (1 carton @ Le180,000). In the future, Alieu plans to open a lager store and build a house. He is a hardworking business man. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
Iván originario de Estelí, 37 años, casado, padre de 5 hijos entre las edades de 5, 2, 10,12 y 14 años de edad respectivamente, de oficio comerciante. El  se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de medicina naturales. El dice que fue elegido para una beca que le daban para ir a Panamá a estudiar medicina natural y fue allí que adquirió conocimiento para elaborar la medicina natural, del cual es propietario hace 15 años, ya que este ha sido su primer negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, de esta manera el comercializa sus productos en Estelí  y en el Salvador, cuenta con otros ingresos, como es su negocio  la venta de refresco.
Sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio para incrementar las ventas y asi obtener mas ganancias para el sustento del hogar. Iván solicita el préstamo para la compra de medicamentos naturales que necesita como omega 3, reductores y shampoo. El estima que teniendo más productos en inventarios, podrá vender más a sus clientes, de esta manera incrementar sus ventas y ampliar su negocio,  sus planes futuros es  poder poner un laboratorios de medicina natural y comprar maquinas para la elaboración de sus productos naturales, su meta es invertir mas en su negocio y poder reparar su casa, para darle una mejor presentación a su farmacia.
texts.en:
Iván, a native of Estelí, is 37 years old and married.  He is the father of 5 children aged 5, 2, 10, 12, and 14 years.  He is a merchant who makes and sells natural medicines.  He says that he was chosen for a grant that enabled him to go to Panama to study natural medicines.  It was there that he acquired his knowledge of how to make natural medicines. He has had this business for 15 years; it was his first business, and he is able to count on the support of his wife.  In this way, he sells his products in Estelí and in El Salvador.  He also generates some other income from his business selling beverages.  

Iván expects to continue to grow his business so that he can increase his sales and thereby obtain more income to support his household.   Iván is requesting a loan to buy natural medicines that he needs, such as Omega 3, weight loss aids and shampoo.  By having more products in his inventory, he thinks that he will be able to sell more to his customers, and so in this way he will increase his sales and expand his business.  For the future, he plans to set up a natural medicine lab and buy equipment to make his natural products.  His goal is to invest more in his business so that he can make some repairs to his house and also enhance the appearance of his pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy natural products, including Omega 3, weight loss aids and shampoo

loans.name: Hontongnon Séverin

texts.fr: Hontongnon Séverin est âgé de 49 ans et vit au Bénin. Hontongnon Séverin est marié à un certain Pauline. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Hontongnon Séverin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Hontongnon Séverin mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d'années, l’agriculture dans une région du Bénin. Secondairement à cette activité, Hontongnon Séverin fait la transformation des noix de palme et la vente d’huile de palme. Hontongnon Séverin s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Hontongnon Séverin sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité tout en s'approvisionnant en noix de palme en vue de satisfaire sa clientèle et d’avoir plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Hontongnon Séverin is 49 and lives in Benin. He is married to Pauline. 
The couple has five children to support, who all attend school. In addition to their own children, the couple has another child to take care of. Hontongnon Severin lives with his wife and children and ensures together with his wife, the household expenses. To ensure the various family expenses, Hontongnon Severin has been working for twenty years in agriculture in a region of Benin. 
Beside this activity, Hontongnon Severin processes palm kernel and sells palm oil. He gets his supply in a region of Benin. In order to satisfy his customers and to increase his turnover and income, Hontongnon Severin requests a loan from ALIDé for the fourth time. 
This loan will certainly help him increase his activity level while buying his palm kernels to satisfy customer demand and have more profits. The first loans were well repaid.

loans.use: Buy palm kernel and cans of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of corn to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy provisions to resell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice; sugar, beans, oil and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, de 42 años, es una mujer dinámica y muy entusiasta, convive con su pareja y tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en su casa propia, donde trabaja a diario para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. La ciudad de Pucallpa tiene un clima muy caluroso, esta característica hace que sus pobladores estén en búsqueda constante de bebidas naturales y refrescantes que sacien su sed. Es así que Sandra, prepara los refrescos más deliciosos con las mejores frutas de la región, aunque su principal producto en la “chicha morada”  elaborada con maíz morado. Tiene una refrigeradora en su casa y ahí coloca a diario cada una de las botellas que contiene el refresco que ha preparado para vender. Atiende todo el día y lo hace desde hace 2 años y gracias al tiempo que lleva en esta actividad ha podido acentuar el gusto y sabor perfecto que prefieren sus clientes. Eventualmente complementa la variedad de los productos que ofrece con la venta de gaseosas. Trabaja siempre sola, ya que su labor no requiere de ningún esfuerzo en la atención, lo que más le pone feliz es observar a sus clientes degustar con mucho placer las refrescantes bebidas que prepara  y eso le permite seguir vendiendo mayor cantidad. Este será el préstamo número 13 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son muy solidarios y responsables. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará frutas, maíz morado y todo lo necesario para continuar preparando los refrescos que pone a la venta en su negocio, además comprará gaseosas de diversos sabores.
texts.en:
Sandra, 42 years old, is a dynamic and enthusiastic woman. She lives with her husband and two children who are 20 and 16 years old. She lives with her family in her own house, where she works every day in order to be able to offer them a better quality of life. 

The city of Pucallpa has a very warm climate and this characteristic means that the inhabitants are always looking for natural and refreshing drinks to quench their thirst. This is why Sandra prepares the most delicious beverages with the best fruits in the region, although her main product is the “chicha morada” made with purple corn.

She has a refrigerator at home and everyday she places each one of the bottles containing the soft drink that she has prepared to sell. She sells there all day and she has been doing this for 2 years and thanks to the time she has put into the activity she has been able to enhance the perfect taste and flavor that her customers prefer.

Eventually she will complement the variety of products that she offers by selling soft drinks. She always works alone, as her work does not require any exertion while working. What she likes the most is watching her customers enjoy with much pleasure the refreshing beverages she prepares and that permits her to continue selling increased quantities.

This will be her 13th loan through MFP, and she thanks those people that offer her the credit she needs in order to increase her working capital. She promises to make her payments on time. She is happy that she belongs to a communal bank that is very united and trustworthy.

With the requested amount of 1,000 soles, she will buy fruit, purple corn, and everything necessary to continue preparing the refreshments that she sells in her business, and also she will buy various flavors of soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy fruit and purple corn in quantity for her homemade beverages she sells from her house

loans.name: Ghida Group

texts.en:
Ghida is a group which is comprised of 2 women and 2 men who are from Taiz, Yemen. They took a loan of 190000 YER.
Eyman is 31 years old, married and has 3 children. 

She owns a house and would like to live in comfortable conditions. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her home. Her ambition is to have a farm to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.name: Al-Haithm Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Haithm, and it consists of 3 women and one man who are hardworking. They took a loan of 140,000 YER. 

Ahlam, 24, is the loving mother of three children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is a tailor. She has tried to work harder, for she has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. 

Due to the high costs of commodities, she has requested a youth loan of 30000 YER to buy a sewing machine for her business. In the future, she hopes to open a big store to get more income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Al-Az Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Az and consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They are working hard so that they can achieve their goals. 

Ashwaq is 26 years old and is the president of the group. She has four children. She sells food items like potatoes and eggs. She's been involved in this activity for three years. She says that she began with a small amount and, thanks to sacrifice and daily hard work, she has been able to grow and continually improve her business. 

She is asking for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase potatoes and eggs in order to be able to continue her business. She hopes to open a retail shop and buy a refrigerator for selling ice cream.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and eggs in order to be able to continue her business.

loans.name: Maha Laxmi Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, five active ladies from a rural village called Tukla in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India formed a Joint Liability Group named Maha Laxmi with the intention of expanding their existing businesses by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Dalimba, an energetic lady of 27 years sitting in the middle of the photo with her hand raised, is one of the group members. She is very active and always cheerful. Her family consists of her husband, one son who is nine and one daughter who is five years old. .Both the kids are studying in the local primary school.

For the last 10 years, Dalimba has been running a clothes vending business and a tailoring center with the help and support of her husband. She purchases saris and ready made garments from the local market as well as from the wholesale market 200 kilometers away. Her husband travels to different villages and weekly markets on a bike to sell saris and garments. Her stock includes saris ranging from 500 INR to 3000 INR. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR from her existing business. But her present income is like hand to mouth for her family. So Dalimba wants to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business. Looking into the present scenario at the market, she is planning to purchase some quality saris and fancy garments to sell. Dalimba assumes that this will generate some extra income.

Dalimba has a strong desire to give a better education to her children. She has a dream of giving her family a bright future by doing hard work with sincerity.

The other four members of the group are Mamata, Urmila, Golapa and Marua who are have a seasonal agricultural business, a Tiffin hotel, a general store and a cloth business, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase quality saris and fancy garments

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en: Hudson is a 56-year-old married man. He describes himself as a caring and responsible man. He operates a grocery store, where he sells vegetables such as potatoes, kale, and cabbage. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate water for his family members' household use. He will use the 8700 KES loan to buy a water tank, which his ten family members will use for household purposes. His business goal is to improve his grocery store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana;la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,gaseosas ,golosinas entre otros,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como gaseosas y azucar para su negocio.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to "Valle Sagrado de Calca" Communal Bank, located in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

  The member is Juana, who remains active with her grocery store business. She has had this business for a while, which is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it each day.  She sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar, milk, soda, and snacks, among others.  She wants to be able to keep on working in order to continue supporting her family.  

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as soda and sugar for her business. 

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soda and sugar for her business.

loans.name: 06.02.05 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hằng has a retail business selling incense and ghost money. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make votive objects to sell. Hằng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hằng is 47 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 06.02.06 Ðông Vệ  solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Hằng lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hằng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make votive objects to sell.
